p: The chromatographic analysis of C. oppositifolia methanol extract (COME) allowed the detection and tentative identification of 43 chemical constituents ( Figure 1). The most representative chemical classes were flavonoids (21 compounds) and phenolic acids (12 compounds), while small amounts of coumarins, triterpenes, and anthocyanins were also identified ( Table 1). Detected flavonoids and phenolic acids were quantified using calibration curves built from reference standards, and the results were in alignment with previously published quantitative data on the same plant species [ 20].
